org.itemscript.core
Interface JsonSystem

All Superinterfaces:
JsonAccess, JsonFactory
All Known Implementing Classes:
ItemscriptSystem
public interface JsonSystem
extends JsonAccess, JsonFactory

A JsonSystem provides access to facilities for parsing, storing, and manipulating JSON values.

Author:
Jacob Davies
jacob@itemscript.org

generateUuid

java.lang.String generateUuid()
Generate a random UUID string.

Returns:

get

JsonValue get(java.lang.String url)
Get a value from the given URL. If the URL is relative, it will be interpreted as relative to the URL "mem:/".

Parameters:
url - The URL to get the value from.
Returns:
The value returned from the URL.

get

void get(java.lang.String url,
         GetCallback callback)
Get a value from the given URL, asynchronously. If the URL is relative, it will be interpreted as relative to the URL "mem:/". Calls the given callback when the value has been retrieved.

Parameters:
url - The URL to get the value from.
callback - Called when the value is returned.

get

JsonValue get(Url url)
Get a value from the given URL. If the URL is relative, it will be interpreted as relative to the URL "mem:/".

Parameters:
url - The URL to get the value from.
Returns:
The value returned from the URL.

get

void get(Url url,
         GetCallback callback)
Get a value from the given URL, asynchronously. If the URL is relative, it will be interpreted as relative to the URL "mem:/". Calls the given callback when the value has been retrieved.

Parameters:
url - The URL to get the value from.
callback - Called when the value is returned.

parse

JsonValue parse(java.lang.String json)
Parse the contents of the given string as JSON.

Specified by:
parse in interface JsonFactory
Parameters:
json - The string containing JSON to be parsed.
Returns:
The JsonValue corresponding to the string.

parseReader

JsonValue parseReader(java.lang.Object reader)
Parse the contents of the given Reader as JSON. The argument is specified as Object only because GWT does not contain Reader. This method is inoperative in the GWT environment.

Specified by:
parseReader in interface JsonFactory
Parameters:
reader - The Reader to parse.
Returns:
The JsonValue corresponding to the contents of the Reader.

put

JsonValue put(java.lang.String url,
              JsonValue value)
Put a value at the given URL.

Parameters:
url - The URL where the value is to be put.
value - The value to put.
Returns:
The value returned by the put, which may not be the same as the value that was put.

put

void put(java.lang.String url,
         JsonValue value,
         PutCallback callback)
Put a value at the given URL, calling the given callback when the operation is complete.

Parameters:
url - The URL where the value is to be put.
value - The value to put.
callback - Called when the put operation is complete.
